bug.author: adamhall
bug.summary: The v1.15 documentation link is broken
bug.description: The v1.15 documentation link seems to be broken :(. It leads me to this page <denchmark-link:https://gpflow.readthedocs.io/en/v1.5.1-docs/>https://gpflow.readthedocs.io/en/v1.5.1-docs/</denchmark-link> which does not exist.

comments.comment: Thanks for letting us know. By the way, we highly recommend using GPflow 2 rather than GPflow 1 if you can
Where did you find the broken link?

It's on the GPflow main page in section <denchmark-link:https://github.com/GPflow/GPflow#install-the-last-gpflow-version-compatible-with-tensorflow-1>Install the last GPflow version compatible with TensorFlow 1:</denchmark-link> . I'm trying to use someone else's code and they use an older version of GPFlow (version 0.4.0!!!!) and am just trying to understand a couple things. Any chance you have a link to documentation for that version?
re 0.4.0, your best bet would be to checkout that version in the repository and look at/build the docs yourself from there. It's unlikely we have that version hosted anywhere

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/adamhall>@adamhall</denchmark-link> thanks again for reporting this! The v1.5.1-docs had disappeared when we improved our workflow and started using a separate repository to host the compiled notebooks. I've just fixed that, so <denchmark-link:https://gpflow.readthedocs.io/en/v1.5.1-docs/>https://gpflow.readthedocs.io/en/v1.5.1-docs/</denchmark-link> is working again Re 0.4.0, as Joel already pointed out, best to see if you can build the docs from that version in the git history.
